sources: trainingbeta.com/20-min-endurance-workout (Tom Randall & Ollie Torr / Lattice / EpicTV)
_meta.instructions: new_exercises only — append to exercises list. No fixes or updates.

new_exercises.name: 1-on / 1-off Aerobic Intervals (Lattice)

prescription_defaults.notes: 1 min climbing / 1 min rest x 10 rounds = 20 min total. Grade 1-2 below lead onsight. Aim for zero pump — intensity sits just above ARC but below threshold. If pump accumulates by round 6-7, reduce grade next session. Lattice Randall/Torr protocol.

new_exercises.description: Lattice Training 1-on/1-off aerobic capacity protocol (Tom Randall & Ollie Torr). 10 rounds of 1 min climbing / 1 min rest at 1-2 grades below onsight. Classified by Lattice as aerobic capacity, not power endurance — the grade is the key: low enough to stay aerobic and avoid deep pump. Efficient 20-min format, usable on routes, boulders or spray wall. Bridges the gap between long ARC sessions and threshold intervals. (Lattice Training EpicTV 20-min Endurance Workout; Tom Randall UKC endurance series)
cues: Start every round at the 0:00 and 2:00 marks — use a visible timer
Grade: 1-2 letter grades below your lead onsight. Both work; 2 below is safer aerobically
Round 1-4 should feel almost too easy — that is correct. Do not raise grade
If pump builds by round 6-7, you are too hard: grade down next session
1 min rest: arms below heart level, shake out, breathe. Full but not excessive

new_exercises.name: Aerobic Pyramid Intervals (1-2-3-4-3-2-1)

prescription_defaults.notes: Pyramid: 1 min on / 1 off → 2/2 → 3/3 → 4/4 → 3/3 → 2/2 → 1/1. 7 rounds total = ~28 min. Grade 2 below redpoint. Aerobic target — avoid pump throughout. Beginners start with just 3 rounds (1-2-3 without descent). Horst pyramid protocol.

new_exercises.description: Hörst aerobic pyramid: 1-2-3-4-3-2-1 min climbing intervals with equal rest, totalling ~28 min. Grade stays constant throughout (2 below redpoint limit, ~2 below onsight). The ascending rounds build aerobic load progressively; the descending side maintains stimulus while fatigue accumulates. Makes standard ARC sessions more mentally engaging. First-timers should stop at the peak (1-2-3) to avoid excessive volume. (Hörst / Lucie Hanes, trainingforclimbing.com aerobic vs anaerobic article)
cues: Equal work = equal rest at every level: 1/1, 2/2, 3/3, 4/4...
Grade is fixed throughout the pyramid — do not increase as rounds get longer
4-min rounds should feel sustainably hard but never cause full pump
Beginners: do 1-2-3 only (no descent) — ~12 min total, build from there
After the session: arms felt lightly worked, not pumped. If pumped, grade too hard
